website_summaries.verdict: These top-selling earplugs are a good deal, and provide a soft fit and reliable sound protection that works well for most users, though they have some issues.
pros: Provides protection for noise up to 32 decibels
Soft foam material is easy to place in the ear
Affordable – 50 pair come in the jar
cons: Inconsistencies in shape found in pack
Difficult to get a precise fit from some Ultrasofts
May not work for very loud noises

customer_reviews.title: NOT ultra soft anymore! Not same squish. BOOOO!
customer_reviews.text: What happened? These used to be made from angel fat. The squishiest earplug out there. Now, they are as hard as a correction officers eyeballs. These are no different than the other ear plugs. I have plugs from other containers, still, and these are like they’ve been left in a microwave oven too long. They feel just like everyone else’s plugs. Soooo very disappointed. Did y’all change the formula? The method of manufacture? The source? These are NOT ultra soft.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieM

customer_reviews.title: Product changed
customer_reviews.text: These were the best ear plugs, they were super soft and sealed the ear perfectly. Now the new material is terrible, doesn’t create a seal and they’re hard. Returning and buying another brand. Like others have stated, the reviews which were great in these are for the original ones. How dare they change a product and not let us know on the packaging. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AppleFan

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these ear plugs. They advertise as 32db sound blockage, but that is just for the material used. The problem is they made the diameter so small that there is very little expansion inside the ear canal. They are probably ok if you have a small diameter ear canal, as seen in many women. But for most men, these Macks will not work very well. Another example of a company trying to reduce costs, but in the process produced an inferior product. Flents ear plugs are much better. Initial diameter of ear plug is much larger, therefore greater expansion in the ear canal. I'am returning the Mack's ear plugs due to poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Doesn't drown out the noise completely
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Doesn't drown out the noise completely, but a majority of it is. I am using these currently in nursing school and I'm one of those students who needs complete silence in order to study. These have been great for just that! I'm able to study in the same room as my husband, while he watches TV (on a reasonable low volume, mind you) and it doesn't interrupt my thinking. Great for test taking as well. Keeps me focused through the test without all that background noise. Love these plugs!
customer_reviews.author: Nurse26

customer_reviews.title: Superior to Mack's Original Extreme Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I own both Mack's original and the ultra-soft iteration (proof in photos) Not only is this one cheaper by about $2, but they match the Original's noise blocking and are superior in both fit and comfort. With the extreme comfort version I will undoubtedly have inner ear canal pain by the time I wake up. So much so that when I use q-tips I have to be very ginger when swabbing the inside of my ear. With these, albeit it's only been a few nights, there is zero discomfort dislodging them after waking up. I find they are thicker and squishier and so create a more seamless, painless seal.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Mack's Ear Care Ultra Soft Foam Earplugs, 50...
customer_reviews.text: Mack's Ear Care Ultra Soft Foam Earplugs, 50...; item comes as described; epic price for quantity and quality; Uncle Sam introduced me to earplugs, and a life time later i used them in construction and EMS related situations. Now i have children... I keep these on the head board or near my computer in case Daddy need quiet in order to avoid issuing out correctional measures to the screaming masses running through the house on there summer vacation.
customer_reviews.author: oshirenshi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Noise Cancellation
customer_reviews.text: These are the kind of ear plugs the hospital I go to for MRIs uses. I’ve had to have several MRIs, and if you’ve ever had one, you knkw how noisy they can be. I need to have silence when I sleep (except hopefully, not too much that I don’t hear the alarm clock!). These cancel out much sound while being comfortable to wear and economical. They don’t block out the highest decibels I’ve purchased, but they are more than sufficient for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Sany123Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT stay in ears, moderate noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs do not stay in my ears, and when they do, they are moderate at noise cancellation. These are super soft, but because they don't stay in my ears at night they are virtually useless (my husband snores). I've tried pushing them down, but they reshape and come out, I've tried twisting the tips but they still come out. I did have another brand yellow, more dense that stayed in through the night and were better at noise reduction. I believe I bought them from CVS/Target type store ....I'll have to look for them again. Sadly, I now have an entire bottle of these very comfy, but, ineffective ear plugs :(
customer_reviews.author: Saab B.

customer_reviews.title: mack’s changes color and material
customer_reviews.text: i’ve purchased these for years and despite some subtle design changes over the years, i’ve been fairly happy with them. unfortunately, mack’s has once again changed the design if these earplugs. they have chosen to change the color to a gray shade, making them more noticeable while wearing (right plug is new color). also, the material is inferior resulting in less sound attenuation. after years of using these i will be looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: jbug

customer_reviews.title: Made my ears itch and bleed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what changed with these ear plugs. I have used them for many years and I was quite happy with them. In the last year the manufacturer changed something. The material feels different, the color is different but more importantly they irritate my ear canal. It started with itchy ears but quickly became painful. It may have caused some eczema inside my ears which started bleeding and crusting. Not nice and I had to stop ear plugs for a while. I have now purchased some silicon ear plugs which have not caused any problems. I would no longer recommend Mack's Ultra Soft Foam Earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Cat lady

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to pay a lot of money for ear plugs and the only ones I could find locally were for packages of 100 for over $20.00. I only use them in the summers when I mow, blow sweep, etc. our yard, so I didn't need a lot. These fit my need. Fifty pair will last several summers. They are in a very small container to keep them secure. They are very soft and comfortable to use. They drown out the noise while working but you can still talk to people if you need to without removing the ear plug. They are inexpensive compared to what I found locally and they work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Concealable Earplugs
customer_reviews.text: Great skin-color, small, concealable earplugs. I use these when I am out and about and don’t want to draw attention to the fact that I have earplugs in. They are not, however, the most noise canceling option. For sleeping, I use the larger and more noise canceling Howard Leight plugs. The Howard Leights are annoyingly bright orange, but it’s no wonder they were designed for commercial use—they are incredibly noise canceling. In summary, if your purpose is concealability, go with these for sure. If you need ones that will Completely block the noise of your spouse snoring next to you, you might want to try the larger Howard Leight ones.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bylsma

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical, BUT
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of their noise canceling ability because of how soft they are, however, I quickly found that because they are so soft they actually do an excellent job at blocking out noise! I can’t hear the AC, I can’t hear the toilet flush, I can’t hear my husband walking around. It’s virtually complete silence. I will be ordering these for life.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Ross

customer_reviews.title: They work but are very weird – factory seconds?
customer_reviews.text: A quarter of them are rounded on both ends or too skinny and fall out – 3/4 are normal. Some are hard and lumpy, but most are soft. Did I accidentally get a jar full of factory seconds? Also, 50 pair would be 100 plugs, and I had 96, which is totally fine, but please advertise them as "approximately 50 pair" because 96 ≠ 100.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Hong

customer_reviews.title: The best earplugs you can buy, without getting custom earplugs
customer_reviews.text: I found out about these earplugs from the Extra Pack of Peanuts podcast gift guide (has been featured the past couple years, at least). Since I got these a month or two ago, I’ve worn them to a couple concerts as well as brought them while traveling, just in case I need to drown out the sound from outside of the hotel I’m staying at. They are very comfortable and stay in your ears very well. The container that it comes in is very nice. I am glad that I chose this company’s product, as it is simply the best for earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Less effective and lower quality of store bought Mack's
customer_reviews.text: These Mack's earplugs resemble that of the store purchased kind; but are nowhere near as effective. I have purchased the Mack's 32dB rated earplugs throughout college with a snoring roommate and now with loud upstairs neighbors to sleep; and they have always worked incredible. Normally you plug them in your ears and the world disappears. These are not genuine. You put them in your ear and they expand more quickly than genuine Mack's, and do not form the same seal. You do not feel the moment of silence when the foam expands and reaches the point when it actually blocks hearing, it is as if the foam is less dense and cheaper. BUY THESE IN A STORE.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gorey

customer_reviews.title: Change in material and not as effective.
customer_reviews.text: I think other reviews have echoed this. There has been a change in the materials used. It's softer and easier to squeeze, but it is difficult to insert this into my ears because it is too soft. As I'm inserting it into my ear (following instructions to the T), it loses its shape and form. For someone with small ear canals, this is not a good product. And because of the changed materials used to make this, it does not block out as much sound as the previous version.
customer_reviews.author: Elann

customer_reviews.title: Good ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for sleeping. I have slightly sensitive ears, so it's going to take some time to get used to them and for the ear soreness to go away. These ear plugs are quite a bit softer than other ones I've tried. They block out my wife's snoring well enough that I didn't wake up the first night I tried them. That's a big difference compared to waking up 4-5 times a night. I had to download a louder phone alarm tone so I could hear it. I'm pretty happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Q Dude

customer_reviews.title: Middle of the Road Ear Plug
customer_reviews.text: I had been using Moldex ear plugs prior to these. Moldex were longer than these and properly inserted these have about the same noise kill rate to me, What I don't like is they are much shorter and must be placed into the ear to the point I almost loose them otherwise the noise kill is really not so good. So to me they don't stand out and earn an average rating. I will just go back to store bought Moldex next time.
customer_reviews.author: Rail Bum

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not 32 decibels worth of sound blocking. They get one star for comfort, and one star because they do block a little sound. Minus two stars for being so thin that it blocks such little sound it doesnt make much difference, and minus another because now I paid for and have this huge jar of earplugs I almost never use. Good I guess if you need to block out a very soft background noise, and dont need to concentrate. They are also very comfortable to sleep in, however I only fell asleep in them since everything still sounded normal, and I forgot they were in...
customer_reviews.author: ikinoii

customer_reviews.title: Saves me most nights
customer_reviews.text: They're relatively small as far as this type of earplug goes, so they're not too uncomfortable. But, I have a husband and a 90lb dog that both snore. My husband also often talks in his sleep. If I hope to get any, I have to pop in a couple of these. I can still hear my alarm with these in, but it dulls down the snoring and chatter, so that it doesn't wake me. Just turns it into a background hum, like white noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Way too soft, can't be inserted in the ear
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earplugs based on reviews. They seemed to be more on the positive side. However, after trying to use them for the first time, I could not put them in my ear. They are WAY too soft and they form into a ball when trying to insert them in your ear. It is like trying to stick chewed bubble gum in your ear. I tried it multiple times, but to no avail, they just crumble into a sticky ball that cannot be inserted in the ear. They were useless.
customer_reviews.author: Frustrated

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am from Queens, NY loud hustle and bustle city. I also live on a high traffic street buses, trains and oh yea my parents doing construction on the 2nd floor room above mine..I SLEPT LIKE A BABY at 5 during rush hour...if that's isnt enough proof these work amazingly idk what is... The product itself it very comfy/foam texture and soft and conforms to your ear canal. I have tried others that are uncomfortable to sleep in and you feel them in your ear but definitely not this one. They can be reusable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Agnieszka S

customer_reviews.title: Buy from a different manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the reviews this time. I use them on my motorcycle. I’ve used ear plugs for years and I’ve used this brand in the past. This batch was terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Saulnier

customer_reviews.title: Great for test taking
customer_reviews.text: During the pandemic I was forced to continue grad school online. We lived above a Mexican restaurant and when I would take tests I could hear the steady sounds of the reggaetone beat..... which was insanely distracting! These earbuds did a great job of blocking that out entirely. They are extremely soft and comfortable which has been super nice. These should last me for a great while but if I run out I will definitely be buying this type again.
customer_reviews.author: Zack F.

customer_reviews.title: Effective, low-cost ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs are comfortable, effective, and very affordable. Great for having around the work shop or garage, and great to use when you also need to wear a plexiglass full face shield, as when operating a chain saw. With full-face masks, it is difficult to also wrap a set of ear muffs on. These earplugs are unobtrusive, fit in your pocket, and do a great job of muffling harsh sounds. If you are working with really loud machinery, you can pair these with a set of ear muffs and virtually muffle the entire world. However, for most tasks and while using most shop tools, these are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Nishi

customer_reviews.title: Just right - every time!
customer_reviews.text: As a person with sensitive hearing in a land of loud noises, I wear earplugs regularly. Whether I'm Salsa dancing next to the speaker, studying for an exam, or sleeping next to a snorer, life is noisy. I appreciate the flesh color, but wish that the flesh color came in different sizes and shades for some of my friends. For my ears, these are incredibly comfortable, and I believe they cut the noise for which they are rated. For really loud endeavors such as using a chainsaw, I use these earplugs with pair of muffs over the top, but that's just me. Unfortunately, if you have a smaller ear canal, they come in a lavender color rather than this color.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Zavala et al.

customer_reviews.title: These hurt while sleeping.
customer_reviews.text: These work to cancel out noise while sleeping, but they are painful. Halfway through the night I have terrible pain in my ears and have to remove them. They do cancel noise. May be good for anything other than sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Still great at sound reduction. But I don't remember them looking so filthy before
customer_reviews.text: I used to order this brand years ago andi don't recall them ever looking this filthy. Random ones on the top look like they've been worn. Otherwise good at blocking out sound in a test run. I'll know how well they work this weekend up north in a cabin with 20 loud people I will update my review at that time.
customer_reviews.author: RebelLemming

customer_reviews.title: These have gone way down in quality.
customer_reviews.text: I need these to sleep. They used to work perfectly for me. I just ordered a bottle recently and they've changed how they make them! They're useless! The slightest sound wakes me up now; I used to sleep undisturbed. I still had an older one and compared the two. The new ones are MUCH less dense than the old ones. Just mushy. I'm very disappointed that the company would change how they make a product. Even the newer orange ones, which my husband has, aren't the same as older versions. There is no way that they are offering the claimed reduction in noise levels.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Defective product.
customer_reviews.text: This product did not cancel any noise. It seems as though when I squish the tip it stays as such not expanding again. I live in A hot climate. Maybe the transportation was too hot I dont know. It is a complete fail. I buy almost eveything from amazon. This is a disappointing experience. I needed them for Training.
customer_reviews.author: Gia

customer_reviews.title: Too Small Changed Product Size is BAD
customer_reviews.text: They changed the size on these and made them smaller...why, to save .00001 cents per plug??? What a waste of everybody's time and money. They don't block out sound as well and I nearly lose them in my ear canal compared to the other ones I've used. DON"T BUY THESE!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Skowronski

customer_reviews.title: These work better than any others I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: If you can get these inserted just right, there is NO noise. Even if you can't get them inserted for that supreme level of quiet, they're still quite effective. Better than the shooter's earplugs I've used in the past. The only problem really is that you can hear yourself chew - at least when you're eating a nice crisp salad, lol. I'd rather live with that than with the screaming children, multiple tv sets, and loud customers in a popular restaurant!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Hard, not comfortable, not recommended
customer_reviews.text: These are more rigid, and less comfortable than just about any earplugs I've purchased before (eg. Howard Leight). They are not soft, and do not have a flared tip to help with grabbing. Not sure why this is one of the only brands available on Amazon. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: 5-Star Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Super soft and gets the job done!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this because my husband snores. I've tried many different brands but found one I liked and stuck to it for about 10 years. Since I couldn't find it when I needed more, I decided to go with this brand... I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED!!! These earplugs are amazing!!! I wish I had switched sooner. Noise cancelation is perfect and they are so soft!! They're a dream to sleep with in my ears. Wow! They are also a bit shorter than the brand I was used to, which is awesome for me, because they don't stick out: they go in and stay in. Love it!!!! Highly recommend them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Acbunker

customer_reviews.title: Don't create a good seal for me
customer_reviews.text: I've used a variety of earplugs over the years, but these are the first ones that just plain don't make a good seal for me. I've even tried the "pull back your ear lobe with the opposite hand" method of inserting (which I've never felt compelled to do before) but they just don't swell up sufficiently to block sound. Disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: iphonedanno

customer_reviews.title: Easier to put in
customer_reviews.text: My right ear canal is not perfectly straight, so sometimes it takes more than one try to get an ear plug fully seated. These seem to be just slightly smaller, and, as the label says, extra soft, so they can be compressed a little more fully. Thus, they are slightly easier to put in. I have not noticed any difference in sound-dampening capability among any of the plugs that I have used as long as they are fully inserted. But if you have smaller ears, or any other difficulties with putting them in, you might want to try these.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: These do a great job at bringing down the noise without feeling like you have socks in your ears. What i like about them is that if i reuse a pair, it doesn't lose its "shrinkness" so it can go back in your ears. Other brands, after a few uses, they stop shrinking and won't go back in your ears and they end up falling out in the middle of the night, but not these!
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.

customer_reviews.title: Search is over - no more sore ears
customer_reviews.text: I finally found my go-to earplugs! I tried all of them: Mack’s dream girl, snore blockers, slim fit, you name it, but I would always wake up with sore ears. Not anymore! These are so soft and don’t hurt my ear. AND block noises even better than all the other ones. Finally I can get some sleep and don’t wake up when crickets fart at night.
customer_reviews.author: Satty83

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Avoid. These are junk. I'm going to contact Amazon for a refund after the refund window expired. I'm finding that these do not work to cancel any significant amount of noise no matter how many times I try to put them in. I've used Blue Hearos for years and Amazon recommended these when I searched to replace. I would describe them as dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, barely blocks sound in the range of voices
customer_reviews.text: There are two boxes to check when using earplugs: how much sound do they block and how comfortable are they? These earplugs are neither good at blocking noise nor are they comfortable to wear. They pushed against the inside of my ears when in, and only comfortable when almost falling out (read: no seal). Even when uncomfortable shoved into my ear canal, they barely block any sound. This is especially true in the human voice range which is, in my opinion, the most important part of the spectrum to be blocked.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Rucker

customer_reviews.title: Comfy earplugs that do the job
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I bought them because my neighbor gets home every night at about 10pm and blares loud music until late hours of the night. As soon as I heard the bass thumping next door I popped these puppies in and I was able to fall asleep to the sound of silence. I couldn’t hear the music at all. They are comfy and perfect for sleeping in. I honestly didn’t think I’d be able to fall asleep wearing them, but I had no problem!
customer_reviews.author: ValerieTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Good but "slim fits" better for smaller ear canals
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs are good and do help with muffling sounds. However, I have smaller ears and do have to cut about 1/4 off the end so they don't hurt after wearing for awhile. They can become uncomfortable after wearing for a few hours. I am trying theirbrand and those seem to fit better with less discomfort. However, I do have to cut a little off the end of those, too, but they have less discomfort overall, including after wearing for a while. I will keep these as backups but prefer the others for my smaller ears.
customer_reviews.author: K.H.

customer_reviews.title: A favorite of my mother's for having a good sleep or working with loud stuff!
customer_reviews.text: For years, my mother's used these very earplugs to help her sleep more soundly, or for working with loud tools without damaging her hearing! They work for anyone who needs them badly for sleeping OR working! If she runs out before Christmas or her birthday, I'll know where to go for more, right here on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: ToonXpert87

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and good noise reduction.
customer_reviews.text: I was initially worried that these were slightly smaller than the Hearos that I usually use on my motorcycle and that they would not block out the wind noise, but to the contrary these are actually more comfortable, can wear them for hours without hurting, and get the same noise reduction at half the price of the Hearos. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Egger

customer_reviews.title: works almost perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Someone would have to be right in your room being loud for you to notice. I think these are great for situations like mine where you have a worthless loud talking lady living in the same house who screams for her boyfriend to get her mountain dew because she cant drag her lard filled body ten feet to the fridge. I legit got these so I wouldnt hear her huffing and puffing as she walked up stairs and screamed through out the house... so ya... if you are in in my situation for sure these are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: rianbrolly

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfy and Much More easy to insert than other green / Oarnge types.
customer_reviews.text: These seem a little smaller and a little more squishy than the green / orange landscaping types. These are very comfy for sleeping and stay in all night with out making my ear canal hurt. These are very easy to insert and may be a little too easy. Sometime it feels like I insert them to deep so be careful not to hurt your inner ear. These are great and will buy more for sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: C J M

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I got these because they claim to block to 33db and bc Mack’s is a known brand in earplugs and I could not be more disappointed. These barely muffle the noise. I had been using the store brand from CVS which work great, but ordered these bc I didn’t want to go out to the store. Back to CVS earplugs for me!!
customer_reviews.author: dbt

customer_reviews.title: A little short and therefore difficult to get out.
customer_reviews.text: They work for sleeping but I need to put them really deep in my ear to really get good noise cancellation. In the morning I need a pair of needle nose pliers to get them out. I wish they were maybe about 3mm longer. I tried not putting them as deep but then they don't cancel as much noise.
customer_reviews.author: S. Moon

customer_reviews.title: A must for college students
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for almost two years now. They are the best foam disposable ear plugs, and are a must for any college student living in the dorms! When inserted according to the directions, I cannot hear my roommates whatsoever. You MUST follow the directions for safe and effective insertion and removal. The plugs are very dense, so they take a long time to expand and can make the ear feel very “full” because of that. Use care, and they will serve you well!
customer_reviews.author: Polymer Clay Crafter

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star EarPlugs
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. They fold and insert into ear easy, then expand within 3 or 4 minutes and WOW, sound of snoring bear (hubby) next to me is practicality silenced. Def no problem sleeping next to snorers or loud saw noises when I help him on a project. These are disposable, but I use mine 2-3 nights before it stops opening all the way. Definitely recommend these to anyone needing to block noise.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: recent CHANGE to formulation, no longer expands as well
customer_reviews.text: Work fairly well BUT batches up to six months ago were a different formulation. Three recent bottles are slicker, do not compress and re-expand nearly as well and therefore DO NOT SEAL AS WELL in your ear. They also retain any mis-shapen features from storage, have to throw out a significant number without using.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Gentle and Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty small ear canals and have tried a lot of different earplugs. My usual complaint is that effective earplugs are too big, too stiff, and painful. If you can relate but you're still looking for great noise cancellation, I recommend these or the slim version in purple. Mack's even makes a super slim version in pink that's great for tiny ear canals. All of the earplugs I've tried from them are soft and pillowy, and they don't put too much pressure on my ears. They are very gentle and super effective at cutting out noise. Even next to a loud snorer I sleep like a baby with these puppies.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Good earplugs.
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchase, my pets snore and scratch whilst I sleep, giving me no rest. After purchase, they do still, I mean, ear plugs don’t change pet behaviors. That aside, I sleep better using these ear plugs. They’ve been far better blocking sounds than the cheap airline ear plugs prior to their arrival. So much better, I was surprised how little I could hear. Only wish these were a little shorter, so they can fit into my ear completely. Effective and recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AnotherUser

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on reviews. I've been using a different brand and wanted to give these a try. They didn't work for me. After using them for two weeks, following the directions, I'm going back to the original brand I was using. I'm a very light sleeper so I need good earplugs. Unfortunately, these don't meet my standards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not so great, seller didnt honor "money back guarantee."
customer_reviews.text: As some others have mentioned these ear plugs seem to come in various sizes and the ones I got were too skinny to fit my ear canal so they dont properly block out the noise. I bought them in part because of the manufacturer's maney back guarantee, but after writing Mack's and asking how to return them directly for a refund, no response. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: N4784A

customer_reviews.title: Great for noise protection when shooting firearms
customer_reviews.text: I use these to go shooting fairly often and they work great. I hate using headphones because they get in the way and feel cumbersome. These you can hardly feel and they provide the noise protection you need when shooting. I shoot a wide range of calibers from .22 to 7.62 and I don't have any ringing in my ears after the day is done.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeAmazonian

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried tons of earplugs trust me every brand and every kind from the sticky kind to the female sizes to these . I am a very light sleeper and can’t stand noise when sleeping these are the ONLY earplugs that stay in my ear all night and Keeps sound Like my fan very quiet I’ve already purchased this twice and will keep buying more other earplugs tend to fall out at night when I’m sleeping these really stay. In until I pull them out I have pretty small ear drums I guess
customer_reviews.author: MsNing

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced squishy foam earplugs
customer_reviews.text: I started using these in the hospital because of a medical condition that made me neuro sensitive. I've kept using them. They're great. With the big pack, I can store a pair in my purse, a couple pairs on my nightstand, in my go bag, anywhere I may need a little noise break. I also like that since it's a multi-package I can offer them to others to share. Visiting family loud snorers? Earplugs. Movie crazy pants loud in the theater for some reason? Earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Average ear plugs.
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs aren’t the most comfortable. Although they aren’t too bad, it may take a lot of adjusting to feel right. With these inserts, it always feels awkward to sleep on your side. Also the noise cancellation does not get rid all the outside sounds, but does reduce the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy Lau

customer_reviews.title: Muffles snores
customer_reviews.text: I got these to help me sleep better since the SO snores so loudly. Got so tired (literally) of waking him up to turn over or just to plain stop it. This helps pretty good. It doesn't cancel noise outright, but it does a good job of muffling it down. I also have white noise and fans going and these do completely cancel those noises. In all, my sleep has gotten better and my hubby's backside has less pain from the shoves I used to give.
customer_reviews.author: Alexismd

customer_reviews.title: Much better than average earplugs
customer_reviews.text: I really like that these earplugs compress so quickly and easily. They are comfortable to wear, and they don't irritate my ear canals, which is a real issue for me at times. The only con I can think of is that they compress a bit too easily, and they sometimes slip a bit too far into my ears. When this happens, it takes me some concentration on not freaking out to remove them from my ears. Overall, they are easy to use, comfortable, affordable, and allow me to get a good night's sleep when the birds around me are insufferable.
customer_reviews.author: Sam R.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, easy to install, good noise blocking, not particularly soft or comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These plugs are easy to use, they compress easily & stay compressed while I stuff them in my ears. The noise blocking is very good. They are not as soft & much harsher on my skin than other (more expensive) brands I have been using. By the 4th or 5th night my ears are raw and I can't stand to put them again for a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Ramblin

customer_reviews.title: Need tweezers to get them out
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the 2nd or 3rd time this product has been changed. I actually like the longer plug- the bottle I ordered before this was a darker color and longer. They were easier to retrieve and blocked out more noise. These are short abd get stuck in my ear. I have to use tweezers to get them out. The noise reduction isn’t as great either
customer_reviews.author: By His Grace

customer_reviews.title: God’s gift to my marriage
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly and are comfortable. My husband watches TV loudly AND snores, and both have been the source of much irritation and resentment from me. This product allows us to be in the same space without irritating each other. I literally cannot hear the tv not his snoring, even when he’s right up behind me in bed.
customer_reviews.author: The Berry Family

customer_reviews.title: Perfect earplugs!
customer_reviews.text: I am a small female who sleeps with earplugs every night. Hubby snores, and I need my sleep! These are they absolute perfect fit! They are smaller than others I have tried, so I was a bit leery that they would work well. They fit perfectly in my smaller ears, and imagine my surprise when not only did I sleep through the night, but also through my alarm! These little gems are the most noise-cancelling earplugs I have ever used. I have found my perfect ones!
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: For a product so highly rated im a bit let down by these. They arent very flexible and dont seem to stay in very well. They are quite large so if you have unusually small ears i would find a different product. And i expected them to block out more sound. Even if i push and hold them into my ears many noises still get through. If you are looking for near silence you should try a different product. These are more like sound mufflers not silencers
customer_reviews.author: Don Budz

customer_reviews.title: Crush and expansion
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers commented that these earplugs compressed and that they did not re-expand. My experience has been that they work like any other similar earplug. Basically you roll them between your thumb and forefinger to crush them down, then insert them into your ear. Moments later, you will feel and hear them expand to fit inside your ear canal. I am not a fan of the flesh colored tone, but they work as expected. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Ears hurt after a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: I had to start using these a couple of weeks ago because of loud noise at home, and I do not know why, but my ears hurt. I used another brand of soft foam ear plugs for years and had no problem. But these, even if I put them in just a tiny bit, they just hurt. I don't know if it's because they expand so much that they're creating excessive pressure, or if I'm allergic to the material, or what. But I can't use the rest of these and will go back to the ones I used to use. The noise control side of these is effective, so that's why they're getting a couple of stars.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymice

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT WHEN INSERTED CORRECTLY
customer_reviews.text: At first when I got these plugs I followed another customer's instructions and just squeezed the bottom of the plug and inserted. Doing this just made the plugs pop out of the ear and was very frustrating. If you squeeze and flatten the whole plug, then insert it, the plug will stay in and work great. I had great success when I did my best to flatten it between my fingers. When I did that they stayed in, blocked noise and were very comfortable. I am very hard to please when it comes to ear plugs and these really work very well, and have a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these, wear them every night
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit of a light sleeper, so I wear these when I sleep. These are the best brand and style I've found for long duration wear. I've ordered these at least twice now. Typically wear a pair for about a week before they are too waxy to want to put back in.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Stroup

customer_reviews.title: Good product that unfortunately gave me ear sores
customer_reviews.text: These were fine. Comfortable and blocked out noise - however they were giving me ear sores in on my ears. It was becoming too painful to wear them so I thought I would stop and let the sores or pimples that were in my right ear heal and they did. I started using them again and the sores came back. Too painful for me to wear so I’m hoping that the beeswax ear plus work a little better for me. Overall the product is good as long as you don’t get any pimples or sores in your ear!
customer_reviews.author: Pin3r

customer_reviews.title: Got a late night noise making turd in your vicinity?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these due to the late night, goose stomping, jazz/trumpet playing Caucasian and his special needs son who lives in the apartment above me and my family. I crank my televisions volume way up, and I compress these plugs by pinching and rotating them between my thumbs and forefingers, and I cram them into my ear canal. They work most excellently!!
customer_reviews.author: Huevosgigantes1

customer_reviews.title: Quality Earplugs
customer_reviews.text: Look at the price of these earplugs. Don't expect these to be like Bose Noise Cancelling earplugs. They're super budget friendly and hygienic earplugs. With that said, these do their job and I loved using them! I don't know why other people are complaining about the fit or the size. Just roll the front end and then slide the earplug in your ear. As the earplug expands, it'll create its own seal in your ear. Simple as that. No complaints and it blocked out the noise super groovy~
customer_reviews.author: Young-Seok Yuh

customer_reviews.title: Handy, effective and exactly as they were four years ago.
customer_reviews.text: There was a review that I saw indicating that these are not the original Mack's ear plugs. I have no idea what they guy was talking about. I bought a bottle of these from a local target about 4 years ago and finally ran out of them. I ordered these... and they are exactly what the last bottle was; quality, effective, but for me, a little too short. I still give them five stars as they are so inexpensive and effective. I just keep a pair of tweezers handy for pulling them out of my ears.
customer_reviews.author: John Hermanson

customer_reviews.title: Best ear plugs I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with Mack’s Ultra Soft Foam Earplugs! 1st time trying them & so happy I did. They go in very easy, very comfortable~doesn’t even feel like I have 1 in~ & very soft. I don’t hear a peep while I sleep now. The size of the bottle & price with subscribe & save is awesome! Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: meshelle

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I mostly buy the $1 store ones, but read reviews that said these were good. I like them better. They are softer and work better. It blocks voices far off and muffles dampens close voices better then $1 ones. I wear a lot during the day very comfortable. They also wash well to reuse, I use hand soap and let air dry. Note the ones I got do not come in plastic bags they are all lose in a small plastic bin.
customer_reviews.author: cbuyfun

customer_reviews.title: Too small, not that soft
customer_reviews.text: I tried these based on Amazon's recommendation and was disappointed. I have been using Howard Leight Max-1 earplugs for when I needed to get some quiet sleep, but they would get uncomfortable after a couple of days (using different pairs, not the same set of plugs!) I tried these plugs and they were not large enough to fill my ear canal and would still hear my wife's snoring. I pulled them out and put in a pair of the Howard Leight plugs and was able to fall asleep immediately. Also, they were not that soft! So, unless you have very narrow ear-holes, go get the Howard Leight Max-1 plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Blocks or mutes most sounds
customer_reviews.text: These are a dream. My upstairs neighbor is inconsiderate and doesn’t realize they live in an apartment with their surround sound blasting, as well as their major stomping, and dropping weights, but this blocks all of that out. I can still hear my alarm clock, which is most important to me. You can still hear, it’s more of a muted sound. I do feel a little stopped up when I sleep with them. They aren’t 100% comfortable, but everyone has different ear shapes, it’s nothing unbearable whatsoever. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: karise

customer_reviews.title: I'm shocked it actually works
customer_reviews.text: I'm an extremely light sleeper, I can practically wake up from a feather dropping so you can guess I get countless of hours of no sleep. My girlfriend always suggested to buy ear plugs but I have this sort of fear I would wake up and it would be stuck, so I decided to try out my very first ear plug and I must say. These work like a charm! Everything is extremely quiet, I can't hear any ambient noise, my girlfriend snoring (she'll hate me if she finds this comment), and our kid playing around in her room. I'm literally a bear on the bed, undisturbed and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Gordon

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT like the store bought ones. Painful.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this item. I should have listened to the reviews but thought some people were getting one-offs. It is not the same as the ones sold in the store despite identical packaging. These are painful on the ears after about an hour or two. I have some store bought ones and I can have those in for hours without an issue. This is just another way to make money for lesser quality product.
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Despite following the instructions, these did very little to block noise while I slept. I suffer from insomnia and am a light sleeper. The ear plugs are too large once they expand inside the ear canal, and I feel like they leave a gap or aren't sealing correctly so noise gets through. I'm a petite woman with small ears. I used these for a few nights to block any household noises or the dog's snoring, but they weren't helpful. I could still hear almost everything. If these are rated for 32 decibels, then they should prevent some noise. This was not my experience. Into the trash they go.
customer_reviews.author: MusicfanTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: These are the SUPER soft ones and SHORTer than other earplugs I've had
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I couldn't get these to stay in my ears. I had to buy other ones, and when I compared them, these are MUCH shorter than all of the other earbuds I tried. Wouldn't stay in my ears, so worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great product, not one size fits all.
customer_reviews.text: Anatomy differs. Mine includes large-bore ear canals. The result is that these 'standard' diameter plugs don't provide the level of protection that 'large' diameter plugs do. I didn't discover this until after purchase. I'll let others use these and I'll use the Large 3M EARS plugs (ordered after these didn't work out).  If you're new to hearing conservation, don't assume that because you stuffed something in your ear it's effective. Know how to properly insert plugs. (example  And if, 45 seconds later, you can still hear almost everything you could hear before inserting with nearly equal clarity, assume they're not fitting correctly. Don't engage in 'loud' activities unprotected because you didn't understand what good protection sounds like.
customer_reviews.author: neil's son

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the color was skin tone instead of bright orange like the Maxx ones Iusually wear. However, these were too small defeating the purpose. I am a petite woman with small size head. I was reinbursed.
customer_reviews.author: Denisey

customer_reviews.title: Super Soft and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why others are saying these are hard. The free earplugs that came with my sleeping mask were hard. These are like marshmallows that form well in your ears. Well priced. I've used these on meditation retreats, sleeping in the woods, sleeping in Walmart parking lots, sleeping in a loud BnB in NYC. Not perfect, but for the price it's the best I've used. So far I've only used Flents Quiet Please Ear Plugs NRR 29. A bit hard and not a 32 rating.
customer_reviews.author: Lost in the Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Very soft....and waddable.
customer_reviews.text: These seemed like a nice idea, but...... I guess my ear canals are just too small . When I try to use these, they just make a little wad of foam in my ear that gets uncomfortable after a couple of minutes. If I "roll" them down to a skinnier shape, they wind up too far in my ear and trigger a cough reflex. They would likely work fine for someone with normal to large ear canals.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Brock

customer_reviews.title: Great for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a bunch of items to help with noise reduction for sleep and these are my favorite. They are small enough that when in, I can sleep on my side without any discomfort and they are the best at knocking out the noise from a near by highway and my neighbors chickens. I saw some reviews about them not being as soft as before, which made me a little nervous about the purchase, but I"ve found them to be very soft and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Josh ollar

customer_reviews.title: Great. Simply Great.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used these ear plugs for a few nights, but I can already say they are the best ear plugs I have used in quite some time - possibly ever. They are comfortable, block out the majority of nosies well, and remain in my ears all night. I have tried a wide variety of ear plugs over the years including fancy $250 ones (they didn’t work out), so you can trust my opinion. If you’re on the fence about purchasing them, go ahead and get off - buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Does What It Should And Does It Well!
customer_reviews.text: My 17-year-old son uses these for sleeping, and he says they work like a charm, plus they're super comfortable! They're so comfortable to him in-fact, he wants to get some for when he's doing yard work with loud machines, or anything that requires earplugs, too! So yeah, whatever it is you could possibly need earplugs for, you should probably get these! They're totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: mbstraughn

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for light sleepers
customer_reviews.text: I live on a very busy street and I have to deal with the loud motorcycles and trucks going by. The white noise machine that I bought didn't help at all. I tried insulating my room as much as possible. These earplugs were my last resort and they have been working wonderfully. Sometimes they fall off my ears in the middle of the night if I twist and turn too much, but I've learned to sleep in one position all night as well as put them on tightly. These little products really helped me get the sleep that I need and I strongly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: GGSM Mobile

customer_reviews.title: Compress really well but are uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: With all the great reviews this product has I was expecting something with good quality and comfortable but I’m disappointed about the product. They compress well and are easy to insert, but they feel like they are pushing my ear canal constantly. I’ve tried them for a couple of weeks every night and always the same sensation, also they didn’t stay in all night. And the Only reason I got them in first place is to block the noise from my roommate in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Iglesias

customer_reviews.title: Husband Snores like a Diesel truck
customer_reviews.text: My husband snores... not like a little but LOUD. I tried 6 other brands before falling on these. These do not block out all of the sound (NONE do) but they cute it down at least 90% where it's bearable. What I really like about this is that they STAY in my ears. Others would fall out which then I would wake up in the middle of the night after hearing he's thunder snoring. I've been using these for over 6 months now and have had the best sleep since purchasing them. Big FAN!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough
customer_reviews.text: Shipped on time with a clean packaging. The product worked so well. Even though, there are still some sounds you can hear through it but it got me sleeping without feeling disturbed. I am a light sleeper. I need close to silence when I sleep. This helped a lot when your roommates are night owls.
customer_reviews.author: A.Lien

customer_reviews.title: So good
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs are amazing, it reduces the noise level so well, I love it then I use it every night cause when I can’t hear any noise it helps me to fall sleep
customer_reviews.author: Dayana E.

customer_reviews.title: Too soft, barely expand
customer_reviews.text: Too soft, too easily lost in ear canal. It happened to me once and i wound up with a $125 doctor bill and 4 hours out of my vacation up the california coast. When I twisted up one of these ugly beige Macks, I remembered in time. I had tried to carefully place it since i had this whole jar of them, but it just didn't work, it barely expanded. Back to the hunt for the stiff yellow ones like the ones they hand out at hotels. They're a much more rigid foam. Hope this helps you.
customer_reviews.author: What's4dinner?

customer_reviews.title: makes the noise go away
customer_reviews.text: i am hooked on earplugs since my dogs like to bark and commercials on tv irritate the crap out of me; used silicone but they stuck to my hair so i chose these after reading the reviews and am very pleased :) i may even become a nicer person now that irritating sounds are blotted out of my life
customer_reviews.author: Joan Voss

customer_reviews.title: This version is MUCH worse than the old version
customer_reviews.text: The other negative reviews are accurate! I wish I read them before purchasing. They changed the composition of the earplugs. They are now longer and no longer comfortable at all. I wish Mack’s said something about the change. I bought these expecting to receive the same old product that’s why I didn’t bother reading reviews. What a sham!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite ear plugs so far. They are more comfortable than ANY of the kinds and brands I have tried. My husband is a serial snorer, and I cannot sleep if I do not have these in. I also have a huge problem with pigeons on my property so I've never been able to take naps during the day, but I can with these. (Yes, I am calling in someone to get rid of the pigeons).
customer_reviews.author: Mariaj480

customer_reviews.title: Easy, cheap, and just works
customer_reviews.text: these doesn't have any special looks to it or design but it just works. The material is comfortable to a point where I sometimes just like to have them in when I am thinking about stuff. I live next to a highway and this almost completely blocks it out, giving me a good night's sleep. For this price, I have put it on subscription. Usually a pair last me 1-2 weeks before I feel like I need new ones.
customer_reviews.author: andynd_reviews

product_meta.title: Mack's Ultra Soft Foam Earplugs, 50 Pair - 33dB Highest NRR, Comfortable Ear Plugs for Sleeping, Snoring, Travel, Concerts, Studying, Loud Noise, Work
product_meta.description: Size:50 PairThese ear plugs are molded with super low-pressure, tapered foam to provide unmatched comfort. With a high noise reduction rating (NRR) of 33 decibels, this high performance hearing protection can be used in environments where noise is just a nuisance up to environments with hazardous noise levels. Great for loud concerts, motor sports, sleep, shooting sports, power tools, etc. directions- with clean hands, roll plug into a tight, crease-free cylinder. With opposite hand, reach over head and pull up and back on outer ear To straighten ear canal. Quickly insert earplug well into ear canal and hold in until it expands for a comfortable, secure fit. Warning: improper fitting will reduce effectiveness and could result in hearing loss or injury.
feature_bullets: ULTRA COMFORTABLE - Made with super low-pressure, slow release, Comfy Cush Comfort Foam. Their user preferred color is as easy on your eyes as they are on your ears.

ULTRA NOISE BLOCKERS – With a Noise Reduction Rating (NRR) of 33 decibels, these versatile, noise blocking earplugs are great for sleeping, studying, work, travel, concerts, relaxation, motorcycling, loud events, etc.

#1 BRAND FOR SNORING, SLEEPING AND TO PROTECT HEARING - Mack’s is the #1 doctor recommended brand of foam earplugs to protect hearing and to get a good night’s sleep when sleeping with a snoring spouse.
#1 BRAND USED BY DOCTORS - Mack’s is the #1 brand of foam earplugs personally used by doctors. Trust the brand that doctors trust.

MADE IN THE USA – Proudly made in the USA with safe, high performance, noise reducing foam. Satisfaction guaranteed. The plastic jar is safety-sealed and features a convenient flip-open top for easy dispensing.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
